Exposure_Definition: Mean weekday television viewing hours between ages 5 and 15 years (parent report ages 5-11; self-report ages 13-15)
Depression_Measure: Diagnostic Interview Schedule (DSM criteria for major depression)
Followup_Months: 36-276 (from age 15 to outcome assessments at ages 18-38)
Covariates_Adjusted: Sex; parent and teacher ratings of worry/fearfulness at age 5; childhood socioeconomic status
Special_Notes: Dunedin Study birth cohort; exposure measured at multiple ages; outcomes assessed at ages 18; 21; 26; 32; 38; NO significant association with depression found (OR 1.08; 95% CI 0.91-1.27 fully adjusted; p=0.390); primary focus was anxiety (significant association found)

Exposure_Definition: Self-reported TV viewing (hours before and after school) and computer use (hours/day); total screen time = TV + computer use
Covariates_Adjusted: Age at baseline; follow-up time; sex; parental educational level; parental marital status; smoking status; alcohol intake in adolescence; school (random effect)
Special_Notes: European Youth Heart Study Danish cohort; TV viewing OR 1.62 (95% CI 1.17-2.25) per hour/day; total screen time OR 1.56 (95% CI 1.16-2.10) per hour/day; computer use NOT associated with depression; dose-response relationship observed; MDI >=20 threshold for depression

Exposure_Definition: Self-reported weekly hours of leisure internet use; latent trajectory classes identified (low-growth vs high-growth)
Depression_Measure: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CESD-8 and CESD-20)
Covariates_Adjusted: Baseline psychological distress (K6); sex; age; parental educational level; annual family income; grandparental caregiving; physical activity; sleep duration; BMI; perceived health condition
Special_Notes: China Family Panel Study (CFPS); 3-wave longitudinal data (2014-2018); latent class growth modeling; high-growth trajectory OR 1.520 (95% CI 1.090-2.120) vs low-growth for depressive symptoms; significant only among rural adolescents (OR 1.853; 95% CI 1.162-2.955); NOT significant among urban adolescents (OR 1.124; 95% CI 0.686-1.840); CESD >=16 threshold

Exposure_Definition: Frequency of visiting social networking websites (Never to Most days; 0-4 scale)
Covariates_Adjusted: Sex; ethnicity; neighborhood disadvantage; household income; maternal education; maternal mental health; prior mental health difficulties (age 7)
Special_Notes: Millennium Cohort Study (Generation Z); primary outcome is psychological distress (K6) not depression specifically; crude OR for psychopathology (K6>=13) 1.25 (95% CI 1.12-1.40); direct effect non-significant after adjustment; significant indirect paths via distrust (females only); time-to-sleep; negative self-perception at age 14; secondary outcomes include depression/anxiety diagnosis; self-harm; suicidality

Exposure_Definition: Self-reported hours of weekly exposure to television; videocassettes; computer games; radio; converted to hours per day
Depression_Measure: 9-item Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale (CES-D)
Covariates_Adjusted: Baseline CES-D score; age; sex; race/ethnicity; socioeconomic status (maternal education); marital status; educational achievement
Special_Notes: Add Health study (Wave 1 1995; Wave 3 2002); TV OR 1.08 (95% CI 1.01-1.16) per hour/day; total media OR 1.05 (95% CI 1.0004-1.10) per hour/day; videocassettes; computer games; radio NOT significant; sex interaction for total media - young women less affected than young men; depression threshold: >=11 females; >=10 males on 9-item CES-D

Exposure_Definition: Average daily screen time calculated as [weekday screen time x 5 + weekend screen time x 2] / 7; parent-reported (Wave 1-9) and self-reported (Wave 10-11); latent class growth model identified three trajectory classes (Low; High; Increasing)
Covariates_Adjusted: Age in wave1; gender; screen time in wave1; parents' divorce; parental education level; family income in wave1
Special_Notes: Chongqing puberty cohort; 11 waves from 2014-2020; LCGM trajectories: Low (68.26%); High (26.37%); Increasing (5.37%); LPA for depression-anxiety comorbidity (4 subtypes); Increasing trajectory -> High comorbidity: OR 3.24 (95% CI 1.04-10.11); High trajectory -> High comorbidity significant only in girls (OR 3.56; 95% CI 1.52-8.33); NOT significant in boys (OR 0.59; p=0.461); SCARED also used for anxiety; outcome assessed during COVID-19 pandemic
